intro: Pentacalia epidendra, commonly known as the white-flowered pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained soil and partial shade.
